review: This is a neat toy, but that is it.  It's a neat TOY!  I wanted it because I am a gadget kind of guy and like little stupid things most people don't.  My wife is just starting to, not so much understand this but live and love me at the same time.  I would have rather bought a new blu-ray or two instead of this again.  Since I have a MacBook Pro, you needed to load CHROME the browser on my device and couldn't use safari.  It's to proprietary to itself and Google.  Cool but not handing them out for Xmas or anything because for what it does and makes you load Chrome for it to work, just not that cool.
author: Kevin Goff

review: I get the idea now -  this is media stream stick, not a PC mirroring device.  That has plusses and minuses.The plus:  You get just the content (or whatever is on your PC/tablet/phone).The minus:  You can't control the content remotely, or at least not without your tablet of phone sitting in front of you.I thought I could get away with an app called Remote Droid Server - which turns my phone into a remote for my desktop or notebook.  That didn't work at all.  Chromecast would have to mirror my PC in order for me to see where my mouse is at any given time.Still, I'm very pleased to be able to watch or listen to anything in my living that's on my tablet, phone or PC.  It's not the same as watching TV, but we don't watch much TV anyway.
